ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to read, write, speak, and listen in Spanish. I've taken multiple Spanish courses throughout my life, and none has ever been this effective or advanced my Spanish by this much. I am now confident I could travel for an extended period amount of time (or live) in a Spanish-speaking country without major problem.
I learned grammar and information about spanish speaking countries.
I learned a lot about grammar and usage techniques, along with improvement in my oral and writing skills.
I developed better conversation, writing, and speaking skills.
I was able to expand my spanish skills
My grammar improved dramatically, and my confidence in my heritage language skyrocketed.
This course helped me a lot with my grammar and speaking skills. It also allowed me to feel more connected with my roots.
I greatly improved my Spanish speaking, writing, and comprehension skills via this course.
As a heritage speaker, this corrected vital mistakes I was making and helped me create a stronger foundation.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths:
- Prof. Alexandrov
- Seminar format
- Regular in-class discussion with active student participation
- Cultural diversity of students (due to heritage format) allows for nuanced discussion of the differences in vocabulary and grammar across the Spanish-speaking world.
- Regular 

Weaknesses:
- 50 minute time slot sometimes feels a bit rushed, 1:20 might be better
A strength of this course was the comfortable environment we had to speak in. Collaborating with fellow classmates during class was very helpful.

Very engaging course with a wonderful teacher. She is very understanding and clearly puts the students first. She is also very professional in how she teaches and relates everyone to the course. She made sure to include students in daily conversation and language excercises.
Prof. Alexandrov is amazing!!!! She's patient, understanding, and she creates a very close-knit, safe community within the classroom.
I really loved to group work and the final project. I cannot think of any weaknesses.

I enjoyed the balance of casual conversation for practicing speaking skills alongside more structured grammar review and practice during class. Really manageable workload as well. It's also so clear that Professor Alexandrov cares about making the class interesting as well as the success of her students. I think the course could be improved by including more "listening" exercises into the homework, for vocab and grammar comprehension. Otherwise, no weaknesses.

Our professor is a great strength. She always was open for feedback and helping us outside of class hours. The collaborative nature of the class was also great. I do wish there was a better understanding of what our grades were throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I already have, and I will continue to do so for all heritage speakers I meet at Yale.
Definitely, it was the first spanish course I have taken that taught lasting lessons.
Yes I would absolutely recommend. The teacher and course offer a lot to heritage students. Prof. Alexandrov knows what is needed for students.
Absolutely. Getting to improve your Spanish in a judgment-free zone is a great opportunity you should take advantage of as a native speaker!!
Yes, I would recommend this course. The professor is amazing and really works with you individually.
Absolutely. If you are a heritage speaker (even one that didn't grow up speaking Spanish fluently in the home), this is the Spanish course for you.
